page.title: 03Castlemorton Common-Farming
page.content: The leasehold of the Common is vested in the Malvern Hills Conservators who issue licences for the grazing of animals. Additionally, owners of properties adjoining the Common may enjoy historic{Commoners' {Rights. }In 1965 the Commons Registration Act was passed whereby people wishing to retain these rights, both for themselves and for future owners of the property, had to apply for registration. As an example, one commoner has the right to take bracken and to graze 3O sheep,1O cattle,2 horses,12 geese,4 pigs and 5O assorted poultry. Any dogs found worrying sheep on the common can be shot on sight. The police can prosecute owners who allow animals to wander on the highway, though motorists are asked not to kill the lambs.
